medical_history.chief_complaint: Significant weight increase, wide glabellar nevus simplex, moderate macroglossia, and enlarging but reducible umbilical hernia in twin 2 (ST).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms in twin 2 (ST) developed after birth and were noted at the first follow-up at 3 months chronological age. Growth was significant as ST reached the 97th percentile for weight, alongside the appearance of a glabellar nevus simplex and macroglossia. The umbilical hernia grew larger but remained reducible.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No infectious or familial risk factors were reported during the pregnancy. The twins were born preterm at 28 6/7 weeks of gestational age without complications.
